channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti tagging, 9th January
item.description:
Graffiti tagging
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cremer Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 large wheelie type bins dumped full of rubbish on street, 9th January
item.description:
These bins were dumped on the street stacked inside each other before Christmas but now they have been separated and people are filling them with rubbish. They are in the middle of the street outside Hayne Court and represent both an obstruction to pedestrians and a health hazard, as the rubbish will attract vermin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayne Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak in the centre of Talbot Road, 9th January
item.description:
Water leak has broken through the road surface outside 64 Talbot Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Talbot Road, Muswell Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Coop using footpath as storage and litter bin, 9th January
item.description:
Hello The staff at Coop have been taking over more and more space on the footpath at the entrance of the shop. They need to be informed that trolleys with garbage cannot be left out for 24 hour prior to collection by their daily delivery truck. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large refuse outside bins, 9th January
item.description:
The bins in the enclosure on the east side of the square are surrounded by large refuse such as a pallet, which goes uncollected when the bin men empty the bins. Please could this be taken away as it is unsightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-11, Charterhouse Square, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St Xaviour's Bridge Lights only worked for a few months, 9th January
item.description:
Lights on St Xaviour's Bridge pedestrian were fixed but only worked for a handful of months. The area is dark, easy to stumble and fall and makes it unsafe past 8pm, when it can get very quiet. Could the Council please address this problem and assess the reasons as to why they stop working! Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Mill Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and bed frame, 9th January
item.description:
Who in their right mind dumps a mattress and bed frame on the corner of a street and finds it a normal thing to doâ€¦ This is a regular fly tipping corner: get a camera in!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elderfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 9th January
item.description:
Despite numerous reports, this drain is still blocked as well as 2 other drains near this junction with Elmstead lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Vacuum cleaner dumping, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kersley Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Red graffiti on bus shed, 9th January
item.description:
Not sure if it's the same person who tagged the bus shelter and walkover in black before, but now the shelter has been graffiti'd in red. I noticed this morning. Perhaps some cameras would be helpful in catching these people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no.198, 9th January
item.description:
Water leaking suspected to be from BT utility box, was reported with thames water 3 days ago but no update yet, water is now leaking into my basement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 198, Broadhurst Gardens, South Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Somone has moved or crashed into the planters which restrict access, consequently cars are using road where there is no access., 9th January
item.description:

item.title: Pothole on the corner of Cliffview Road and vicars hill, 9th January
item.description:
The pothole is dangerous as the big lump in the middle is loose and breaking up, it is also very deep, a cyclist would probably fall off if they hit it It is also very hard to see in the dark. Not sure how long it has been like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cliffview Road, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
